articles.title: Down 19% This Year, Has Apple Stock Become a Bargain Buy?
articles.content: Apple's stock is currently trading around 30 times earnings, which is in line with its five-year average.

articles.title: Apple supplier Skyworks forecasts upbeat quarterly results on strong chip demand
articles.content: Apple supplier Skyworks Solutions forecast fourth-quarter revenue and profit above Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, benefiting from steady demand for its analog chips amid economic uncertainty, sending its shares up around 10% in extended trading. Demand for Skyworks' chips has remained strong, supported by their applications across industries such as automotive and mobile, even as global trade tensions raise concerns over supply chain disruptions and rising costs. "We're encouraged by the momentum in mobile and steady strength across our broad markets, driven by long-term growth trends in edge IoT, automotive and data center," CEO Phil Brace said.

articles.title: Meta vs. Alphabet Stock: The Case for Buying One, Not the Other
articles.content: Loop capital analyst Rob Sanderson increased his price targets on both, but stuck with a hold rating on one.

articles.title: Companies Are Sounding Ebullient on Trump’s Tax Law. Tariffs Could Be a Killer.
articles.content: The tax legislation, which President Donald Trump signed into law on July 4, makes permanent a trio of corporate tax breaks.

articles.title: Commentary: Tariffs are denting profits, and maybe soon your portfolio
articles.content: Dozens of companies are reporting lower profits caused by Trump's tariffs. Stock values haven't adjusted — yet.
